channel.title: Handling IP bans, packet floods, etc
channel.description:
Should the software be prepared for this or should machine/network level catch it before it can affect the application? Is there any point in handling it in the software if iptables catches it before hand?
Probably, as a precaution, right?
What about IP banning? If someone is connection flooding should the software be trained to ignore it or should it run an IP banning script to add a Linux rule similar to what's seen within RSCA's source code?
Thoughts?
